author: Cortex XSOAR

commands.description: Creates a role assignment.
commands.name: gsuite-role-assignment-create

commands.description: Delete all access tokens issued by a user for an application.
commands.name: gsuite-token-revoke

commands.description:
Updates a custom user schema.
Note: field_raw_json has higher precedence when both field_raw_json and field_json_entry_id are provided.
commands.name: gsuite-custom-user-schema-update

commands.description:
Creates a custom user schema to add custom fields to user profiles.
Note: field_raw_json has higher precedence when both field_raw_json and field_json_entry_id are provided.
commands.name: gsuite-custom-user-schema-create

commands.description: Deletes a user.
commands.name: gsuite-user-delete

commands.description: Retreive a group's details given a group key.
commands.name: gsuite-group-get

commands.description: Indicates if the user is forced to change their password at next login.
commands.name: gsuite-user-reset-password

commands.description: Executes an action that affects a ChromeOS device. This includes de-provisioning, disabling, and re-enabling devices.
commands.name: gsuite-chromeosdevice-action

commands.description: Signs a user out of all web and device sessions and reset their sign-in cookies.
commands.name: gsuite-user-signout

commands.description: Updates a user.
commands.name: gsuite-user-update

commands.description: Creates a group with a group name and its description.
commands.name: gsuite-group-create

commands.description:
Inserts a data transfer request.
Note: If all three applications_raw_json, applications_raw_json_entry_id and application_id are provided
the higher precedence will be in order of applications_raw_json, applications_raw_json_entry_id,
and application_id respectively.
commands.name: gsuite-datatransfer-request-create

commands.description: Creates a user.
commands.name: gsuite-user-create

commands.description: Adds an alias.
commands.name: gsuite-user-alias-add

commands.description: Modifies multiple policy values that are applied to a specific group. All targets must have the same target format. That is to say that they must point to the same target resource and must have the same keys specified in additionalTargetKeyNames, though the values for those keys may be different. On failure the request will return the error details as part of the google.rpc.Status.
commands.name: gsuite-policy-modify

commands.description: Retrieves a paginated list of all role assignments.
commands.name: gsuite-role-assignment-list

commands.description: Removes a mobile device. Note that this does not break the device's sync, it simply removes it from the list of devices connected to the domain. If the device still has a valid login/authentication, it will be added back on it's next successful sync.
commands.name: gsuite-mobile-delete

commands.description: Lists the transfers for a customer by source user, destination user, or status.
commands.name: gsuite-datatransfer-list

commands.description: Retrieves a paginated list of company-owned ChromeOS devices.
commands.name: gsuite-chromeosdevice-list

commands.description: Retrieve a user's details given a user key.
commands.name: gsuite-user-get

commands.description: To move Chrome browser devices assigned to an account from one organization unit to another.
commands.name: gsuite-chromebrowserdevice-move-ou

commands.description: Gets the resolved policy values for a list of policies that match a search query.
commands.name: gsuite-policy-resolve

commands.description: Creates a new role.
commands.name: gsuite-role-create

commands.description: Retrieve all Chrome browser devices for an account or a specific Chrome browser device.
commands.name: gsuite-chromebrowserdevice-list

commands.description: Gets a list of policy schemas that match a specified filter value for a given customer.
commands.name: gsuite-policy-schemas-list

commands.description: Delete multiple policy values that are applied to a specific group. All targets must have the same target format. That is to say that they must point to the same target resource and must have the same keys specified in additionalTargetKeyNames, though the values for those keys may be different. On failure the request will return the error details as part of the google.rpc.Status.
commands.name: gsuite-policy-groups-delete

commands.description: Retrieves a paginated list that includes company-owned mobile devices.
commands.name: gsuite-mobiledevice-list

commands.description: Takes an action that affects a mobile device. For example, remotely wiping a device.
commands.name: gsuite-mobile-update

integration.description: G Suite or Google Workspace Admin is an integration to perform an action on IT infrastructure, create users, update settings, and more administrative tasks.
integration.name: Google Workspace Admin

description: G Suite Admin integration with Cortex XSOAR. G Suite or Google Workspace Admin is an integration to perform an action on IT infrastructure, create users, update settings, and more administrative tasks.
name: G Suite Admin
